FacilityName: PPG Architectural Finishes Louisville Dist. Ctr.

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: General Freight Trucking, Long-Distance, Less Than Truckload

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PPG Architectural Finishes - Louisville Distribution Center -Louisville, KY

The PPG Architectural Finishes (PPGAF) Louisville Distribution Center complies with applicable Kentucky and US EPA regulations and applicable Department of Transportation requirements.  PPGAF also follows applicable Coatings Care (registered service trademark) Codes of Management Practices including the Community Awareness Code of Management Practices, and PPG's own Community Awareness and Emergency Response (CAER) Policy to assure emergency preparedness and foster community right-to-know. PPGAF also  trains Distribution Center employees in accident prevention, hazard communication, emergency response, safe material handling procedures and fork truck driving safety. All of these activities form an integral part of PPG's overall Environmental, Health and Safety Policy, whose main goal is "to market, distribute and manufacture products globally in a responsible manner that protect employees, neighbors, customers and the environment."

Regulated Substance Handled

PPGAF Louisville Distribution Center  is a part of the PPG Architectural Finishes business unit. The Louisville DC stores paint, stain and related products and distributes them to independent dealers, PPG owned stores and home centers throughout the central United States. The DC stores products in various size containers, including aerosol spray cans. Some of the aerosols contain propane and butane which are used as propellants.  These two materials are regulated flammable substances under the EPA-RMP regulation. 

Five Year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases of  aerosol  products at the Louisville DC in the past five years, which resulted in on-site or off-site impacts as defined by EPA's RMP criteria.

General Accidental Release Prevention and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

The RMP regulation specifies that covered processes at all facilities must be classified as Program Level 1, 2 or 3 processes. The PP

GAF Louisville DC aerosol storage process is classified as a Program Level 1 process because the Worst-Case Scenario has no off-site impact and because there were no accidental releases in the past five years that meet RMP criteria. Submission of specific prevention program information for Program Level 1 processes is not required by RMP. 

Emergency Response Procedures

PPGAF coordinates emergency response activities with the local fire department. 

Additional Information
 
For additional information, contact Mr. Lloyd Ruiz at 502-588-9823
